item.title: [CAMEL-21740] camel-salesforce - pub/sub API corrupt replay id causes infinite resubscribe loop
item.description:
If there are no new Change Data Capture events for more than 3 days the cached replayId in the PubSubApiClient becomes invalid. (Salesforce Docs)

It seems like the next event/reconnect then causes the client to try to resubscribe indefinitely with this invalid replay id.

I use v4.4.3 but the PubSubApiClient hasn't been changed since then.

comments.comment:
davsclaus 

No problem. I just have one question regarding my PR.

If someone is starting the route with the CUSTOM ReplayIdPreset and supplies an invalid replay id, shouldn't the consumer error out instead of resubscribing with LATEST?
Oh yeah that is a good point. So just wonder when you would use a custom reply id - and would that get invalid over time ? If you eg restart the Camel app 6 months later

If you restart the Camel app after 6 months the saved replay ids should always be invalid because Salesforce retains them only for 3 days.

I think there needs to be some kind of check in the error handler that checks if it is an error on startup of the client/consumer and that a custom replay id is being used.

Then it can throw some kind of error instead of resubscribing with the LATEST preset.
Yes you are welcome to work on a patch for that

I will look into it.

Should I reopen this issue or create a new one?

I don't really know how i can get the exception out of the FetchResponseObserver.
The RuntimeException thrown in my FetchResponseObserver.onError method is always caught in io.grpc.internal.SerializingExecutor and logged after that the thread shuts down.
Maybe someone with more expertise in Camel and gRPC can look into this?
okay so we only set to LATEST if not using custom reply id.
